newsitem.title: CHILE: Aninat welcomes Chile March inflation data.
newsitem.headline: Aninat welcomes Chile March inflation data.

text.p: Chilean Finance Minister Eduardo Aninat said the small rise in March consumer prices brings inflation back on target after two months of sharp increases threatened to skew official goals.
"With March's inflation figures, we have returned to the path of low annualized inflation," Aninat told reporters.
Consumer prices rose 0.3 percent last month compared with a 0.7 percent increase in the same month last year.
The figures brought the increase in prices over the last 12 months to 6.8 percent, down from 7.9 percent in the year ending March 1996.
Aninat said last month's inflation rate was due to the fact that there were no seasonal increases in vegetable prices, which drove up inflation in the first two months of the year.
The government is confident the economy will meet the official inflation target of 5.5 percent, he said.
